bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

bibl.title: Report: List of Articles on Yellow Fever and Malaria, by Henry Rose Carter, August 31, 1935

div1.p: Carter lists twenty-two articles he wrote on yellow fever and malaria. Attached is a handwritten note by Laura Armistead Carter.

div1.head: Report: List of Articles on Yellow Fever and Malaria, by Henry Rose Carter, August 31, 1935
div1.p:
List of Articles on Yellow Fever and Malaria
by
Dr. H. R. Carter, U. S. Public Health Service.

list.item:
1--A Note on the Interval between Infecting and Secondary Cases
of Yellow Fever from the Records of the Yellow Fever at Orwood and
Taylor, Miss., in 1898.
New Orleans Medical & Surgical Journal, May 1900.

2--Period of Incubation of Yellow Fever in Man.
(Planned with (1) and (3) (and written about the same time)--the tri-
logy forming a complete work. Published in Medical Record, Feb. or
March 1901. No reprints on hand. L. A. C.)

3--A Note on the Spread of Yellow Fever in Houses. Extrinsic
Incubation.
Medical Record, June 15, 1901.

4--Mortality of Yellow Fever in Havana from 1886 to 1900.
Public Health Reports, July 1900.

5--A Correlation of Some Facts in the Propagation of Yellow Fever
with the Theory of Its Conveyance by the Culex Fasciatus.
(Written in Nov. 1900 while sick at the Johns Hopkins Hospital. L.A.C.)
The Philadelphia Medical Journal, April 6, 1901.

6--Are Vessels Infected with Yellow Fever? Some Personal Obser-
vations.
Medical Record, March 22, 1902.

7--The Methods of the Conveyance of Yellow Fever Infection.
Yellow Fever Institute, Bulletin No. 10. July, 1902.

8--Some Characteristics of Stegomyia Fasciata Which Affect Its
Conveyance of Yellow Fever.
Medical Record, May 14, 1904.

9--The Conveyance of Yellow Fever.
Medical News, November 5, 1904.

10--A Memorandam from Panama Experience Showing that Yellow Fever
Was Contracted During the Daytime.
(Written April 6, 1906. Pub. Medical Record -- 1906. L.A.C.)

11--Notes on the Sanitation of Yellow Fever and Malaria from
Isthmian Experience.
(Written for Pan-American Scientific Congress held at Santiago de Chile
Dec. '08 to Jan. '09. L. A. C.) Medical Record, July 10, 1909.

12--Yellow Fever, Its Epidemiology, Prevention and Control.
(Lectures delivered March 26 and 27, 1914.)
Supplement No. 19 to the Public Health Reports, Sept. 11, 1914.
GIFT OF BETA CHAPTER
PHI BETA KAPPA
Page 2.
(2) Malaria.

13--Antimalarial Measures for Farmhouses and Plantations.
Reprint No. 105, from Public Health Reports, Dec. 6, 1912.

14--Malarial Survey in North Carolina.
Reprint No. 156, from Public Health Reports, Dec. 19, 1913.

15--Quinine Prophylaxis for Malaria.
Reprint No. 175, from Public Health Reports, March 27, 1914.

16--Screening as an Antimalarial Measure.
Reprint No. 183, from Public Health Reports, April 17, 1914.

17--Quinine-Fast Malarial Parasites.
Southern Medical Journal, May, 1914.

18--Some Educational Methods for Use in Antimalarial Work.
American Journal of Tropical Diseases and Preventive Medicine
June, 1914.

19--Malaria, Lessons on Its Cause and Prevention. For Use in
Schools.
Supplement No. 18 to the Public Health Reports, July 17, 1914.

20--Impounded Water. Some General Considerations on Its Effect
on the Prevalence of Malaria.
Reprint No. 244 from Public Health Reports, Dec. 25, 1914.

21--Impounded Waters. Their Effect on the Prevalence of Malaria--
Survey at Blewette Falls.
Reprint No. 248 from Public Health Reports, Jan. 1, 1915.

22--The Effect of Impounded Water on the Incidence of Malaria.
Southern Medical Journal. March, 1915.

p.add:
Of course there have been many
other articles published from time
to time on purely professional sub-
jects - the first one in 1882, but of
these I have no copies
